meanings.definition: Trim (a tree, shrub, or bush) by cutting away dead or overgrown branches or stems.
meanings.sent1: I enjoy pruning the roses in my garden to keep them healthy and neat.
meanings.sent2: The gardener spent the afternoon pruning the overgrown bushes in the park.
meanings.sent3: After pruning the tree, it looked like it had just gotten a nice haircut.
meanings.sent4: She approached her work like a skilled artist, carefully pruning away the unnecessary branches.
meanings.sent5: The sound of pruning shears filled the air as the garden was tidied up.

meanings.definition: Reduce the extent of (something) by removing superfluous or unwanted parts.
meanings.sent1: We need to start pruning unnecessary expenses to save money for our trip.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to prune its product line to focus on its core offerings.
meanings.sent3: She began pruning her wardrobe, getting rid of clothes she never wore.
meanings.sent4: His editing process involved carefully pruning out any redundant information from the report.
meanings.sent5: The chef skillfully pruned the recipe, simplifying it for home cooks.
